rules.solo: A Dancer that has never competed in a solo in any dance style
rules.duet_trio: Dancers that have never competed in a solo or duet/trio category in any dance style. Dancers in the duet/trio must be 100% Novice
rules.groups: At least 75% of Dancers in the group must be Novice

rules.solo: A Dancer that has never competed in a competitive solo category. Dancer must train 6 hours or less per week
rules.duet_trio: Dancers that have never competed in a competitive solo or duet/trio category. Dancer must train 6 hours or less per week. Dancers in the duet/trio must be 100% Part-Time
rules.groups: At least 75% of Dancers in the group must be Part-Time

rules.training_hours: Any Dancer that trains more than 6 hours per week

groups_lines_productions.note: Groups, Lines, and Productions all use same per-dancer rate

title_upgrade.note: Fee to upgrade a solo to Title Division. Fee is per solo (not per soloist). Soloist may upgrade any number of entries.

notes: All levels are combined for the Regional Title Division
One title winner will be awarded in each age breakdown at all events
Separate scoring for Title Division soloists - Total of 100 marks per judge
Title winner receives custom award, tiara, and full scholarship or cash prize

overall_awards.note: Awarded in each classification for above age divisions

final_awards: Dancer of the Year in Each Age Division

rules.entries_per_studio: One group per division chosen by Studio Director
rules.eligible_groups: Competitive groups (excluding productions) from Mini, Junior, Intermediate, and Senior age divisions
rules.minimum_routines: Studio must enter at least 10 routines to qualify (3 must be groups)

commitments: Ambassador Curated Special Awards Presentation (Event of their Choice)
benefits: Be a Professional Choreographer for a Day

issues: Database has duplicates: Junior, Teen, Petite with different age ranges
Database has divisions NOT in PDF: Pre Junior, Teen, Senior+ (17+)
Mini age range differs: PDF says 6-8, DB has 7-8
Senior age range differs: PDF says 15-17, DB has 15-16

entry_fees.issue: Database competitions have entry_fee=$75 which doesn't match ANY PDF price
entry_fees.question: Should fees be stored per entry_size_category or is $75 a different fee type?

scoring_system.pdf_tiers: Bronze, Silver, Gold, Titanium, Platinum, Pandora
scoring_system.database_tiers: bronze, silver, gold, high_gold, platinum (NO Titanium or Pandora)
score_range_differences: DB has high_gold (90-94.9) NOT in PDF
scoring_system.warning: Changing this is BREAKING - existing scores would be re-categorized
